## SUITS

[*Suits*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series) "Suits (American TV series)") is an American [television drama series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Television_drama_series "Television drama series") created by [Aaron Korsh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaron_Korsh "Aaron Korsh"), which premiered on June 23, 2011 on [USA Network](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USA_Network "USA Network") on June 23, 2011, produced by [Universal Content Productions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Content_Productions "Universal Content Productions").

Set at a [fictional](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fictional "Fictional") [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City "New York City") [law firm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_firm "Law firm"), it follows Mike Ross ([Patrick J. Adams](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_J._Adams "Patrick J. Adams")), who uses his [photographic memory](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photographic_memory "Photographic memory") to talk his way into a job as an associate working for successful closer Harvey Specter ([Gabriel Macht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Macht "Gabriel Macht")), despite being a college dropout who never attended law school.^[\[1\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-SuitsSeriesPremiere-2)^ *Suits* focuses on Harvey and Mike winning lawsuits and closing cases, while at the same time hiding Mike's secret.^[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-3)^ It also features [Rick Hoffman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Hoffman "Rick Hoffman") as neurotic lawyer with a prowess in financial law Louis Litt, [Meghan Markle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meghan_Markle "Meghan Markle") as ambitious [paralegal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paralegal "Paralegal") Rachel Zane, [Sarah Rafferty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_Rafferty "Sarah Rafferty") as Harvey's legal secretary and confidante Donna Paulsen, and [Gina Torres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gina_Torres "Gina Torres") as the firm's managing partner, Jessica Pearson.

On January 30, 2018, the series was renewed for an eighth season although Torres, Adams and Markle all left the show,^[\[3\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-4)^ with [Katherine Heigl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katherine_Heigl "Katherine Heigl") joining the cast as Samantha Wheeler. Recurring characters Alex Williams ([Dulé Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dul%C3%A9_Hill "Dulé Hill")) and Katrina Bennett ([Amanda Schull](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amanda_Schull "Amanda Schull")) were promoted to series regulars.^[\[4\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-S8-Heigl-5)^ The show was renewed for a 10-episode ninth and final season on January 23, 2019, which premiered on July 17, 2019.^[\[5\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-6)[\[6\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-7)^

Throughout its run, *Suits* was nominated for numerous awards, including individual attention for Torres and Adams. Besides two nominations recognizing her role as a supporting actress, Torres was awarded Outstanding Performance in a Television Series at the 2013 [NHMC Impact Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Hispanic_Media_Coalition "National Hispanic Media Coalition"). Adams was nominated for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series at the [2012 Screen Actors Guild Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/18th_Screen_Actors_Guild_Awards "18th Screen Actors Guild Awards"). The show itself was nominated for two [People's Choice Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Choice_Awards "People's Choice Awards"). The show's success spawned a short-lived spin-off, [*Pearson*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_(TV_series) "Pearson (TV series)"), centered on Jessica Pearson's entry into Chicago politics, which premiered alongside the final season of *Suits* on July 17, 2019.^[\[7\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-USA_Network-8)[\[8\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-9)[\[9\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suits_(American_TV_series)#cite_note-Pearson_Premiere_Date-10)^ *Suits* concluded on September 25, 2019, after nine seasons and 134 episodes.
